title: Introduction
description:
The Hubble API lets you view and manage data like accounts, subscriptions, invoices, transactions, and plans.

The Hubble API is basically a REST API. It has predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts form-encoded request bodies, returns JSON-encoded responses, and uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication, and verbs.

sections.title: Authentication
sections.content:
The Hubble API uses API keys to authenticate requests. It uses bearer authentication for its HTTP authentication scheme. You can view and manage your API keys in the Hubble Console.

API keys provide access to senstivie information. Therefore, be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your API keys in places such as GitHub, client-side code, and so on.

All API requests must be made over HTTPS. Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

sections.title: Errors
sections.content: The Hubble API uses HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of a request.

sections.title: Pagination
sections.content:
Most resources have support for bulk fetches via "list" API methods. For instance, you can list accounts, list subscriptions, list invoices, and so on. These list API methods share a common structure for requests and responses. The common attributes in responses include:`totalRecords`, `page`, `limit`, `totalPages`, `previousPage`, and `nextPage`.

Simiarly, the common parameters in requests include: `page` and `limit`, based on which Hubble internally implements a cursor based pagination scheme. Further, some endpoints accept optional filters like `dateRange`, `startDate`, `endDate`, and `search`.

items.name: page
items.description: The number of the page you want to retrieve. It is zero based. The first page is at 0, the second at 1, and so on.

items.name: limit
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: page
items.description: The current page number. It is zero based. The first page is at 0, the second at 1, and so on.

items.name: totalRecords
items.description: The total number of records.

items.name: limit
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: totalPages
items.description: The total number of pages based on `limit` and `totalRecords`.

items.name: previousPage
items.description: The previous zero based page number, if any. Otherwise it is `null`.

items.name: nextPage
items.description: The next zero based page number, if any. Otherwise it is `null`.

items.name: records
items.description: An array of records you requested.

title: Accounts
description: The account object represents your customer and stores all their information. You can access other objects such subscriptions, transactions, and invoices through it.

sections.title: Account Object Schema
sections.content: All the account endpoints adhere to the schema described here.

variants.content:
```json
{
    "id": "5f6190b1966a8f0fd205a00a",
    "subscriptionIds": [],
    "userName": "anushka",
    "firstName": "Anushka",
    "lastName": "Madyanam",
    "emailAddress": "anushka@hubblesuite.com",
    "phoneNumber": "+91 XXXXXXXXXX",
    "addressLine1": "Flat #193, JVM Residency",
    "addressLine2": "19th Cross, JS Town",
    "city": "Bengaluru",
    "state": "Karnataka",
    "country": "India",
    "zipCode": "560033",
    "createdAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z",
    "updatedAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z"
}
```

items.name: id
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that uniquely identifies the account across Hubble Subscriptions. It cannot be generated by the client.

items.name: subscriptionIds
items.description: An array of subscription identifiers. Each identifier represents a subscription owned by the account.

items.name: userName
items.description: The user name that uniquely identifies the account across your organization.

items.name: firstName
items.description: The first name of the account holder.

items.name: lastName
items.description: The last name of the account holder.

items.name: emailAddress
items.description: The email address of the account holder.

items.name: phoneNumber
items.description: The phone number of the account holder.

items.name: addressLine1
items.description: The first address line of the account holder.

items.name: addressLine2
items.description: The second address line of the account holder.

items.name: city
items.description: The city of the account holder.

items.name: state
items.description: The state of the account holder.

items.name: country
items.description: The country of the account holder.

items.name: zipCode
items.description: The zip code of the account holder.

items.name: createdAt
items.description: The time when the account was created, expressed in UTC format.

items.name: updatedAt
items.description: The time when the account was last updated, expressed in UTC format.

sections.title: Create account
sections.content: You can create a new account at the `POST /accounts` endpoint.

variants.content:
```bash
data=\
'{
    "userName": "anushka",
    "firstName": "Anushka",
    "lastName": "Madyanam",
    "emailAddress": "anushka@hubblesuite.com",
    "phoneNumber": "+91 XXXXXXXXXX",
    "addressLine1": "Flat #193, JVM Residency",
    "addressLine2": "19th Cross, JS Town",
    "city": "Bengaluru",
    "state": "Karnataka",
    "country": "India",
    "zipCode": "560033"
}'
echo $data | curl -X POST https://api.hubblesuite.com/accounts \
-H "Authorization: Bearer <API_KEY>" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d @-
```

```json
{
    "id": "5f6190b1966a8f0fd205a00a",
    "subscriptionIds": [],
    "userName": "anushka",
    "firstName": "Anushka",
    "lastName": "Madyanam",
    "emailAddress": "anushka@hubblesuite.com",
    "phoneNumber": "+91 XXXXXXXXXX",
    "addressLine1": "Flat #193, JVM Residency",
    "addressLine2": "19th Cross, JS Town",
    "city": "Bengaluru",
    "state": "Karnataka",
    "country": "India",
    "zipCode": "560033",
    "createdAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z",
    "updatedAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z"
}
```

items.name: userName
items.description: The number of the page you want to retrieve. It is zero based. The first page is at 0, the second at 1, and so on.

items.name: firstName
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: lastName
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: emailAddress
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: phoneNumber
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: addressLine1
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: addressLine2
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: city
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: state
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: country
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

items.name: zipCode
items.description: The maximum number of records you want to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

formats.title: Response
formats.description: Returns the newly created account object. Please see the account object schema section for more information.

sections.title: Fetch account
sections.content: You can retrieve an account from the `GET /accounts/:id` endpoint.

variants.content:
```json
{
    "id": "5f6190b1966a8f0fd205a00a",
    "subscriptionIds": [],
    "userName": "anushka",
    "firstName": "Anushka",
    "lastName": "Madyanam",
    "emailAddress": "anushka@hubblesuite.com",
    "phoneNumber": "+91 XXXXXXXXXX",
    "addressLine1": "Flat #193, JVM Residency",
    "addressLine2": "19th Cross, JS Town",
    "city": "Bengaluru",
    "state": "Karnataka",
    "country": "India",
    "zipCode": "560033",
    "createdAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z",
    "updatedAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z"
}
```

items.name: id
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that identifies the account.

formats.title: Response
formats.description: Returns the requested account object. Please see the account object schema section for more information.

sections.title: List accounts
sections.content: You can list accounts using the `GET /accounts` endpoint.

variants.content:
```json
{
    "totalRecords": 200,
    "page": 0,
    "limit": 10,
    "totalPages": 20,
    "previousPage": null,
    "nextPage": 1,
    "records": [
        {
            "id": "5f6190b1966a8f0fd205a00a",
            "subscriptionIds": [],
            "userName": "anushka",
            "firstName": "Anushka",
            "lastName": "Madyanam",
            "emailAddress": "anushka@hubblesuite.com",
            "phoneNumber": "+91 XXXXXXXXXX",
            "addressLine1": "Flat #193, JVM Residency",
            "addressLine2": "19th Cross, JS Town",
            "city": "Bengaluru",
            "state": "Karnataka",
            "country": "India",
            "zipCode": "560033",
            "createdAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z",
            "updatedAt": "2020-09-16T04:12:33.784Z"
        },
        ...
    ]
}
```

items.name: id
items.description: A string of 24 hexadecimal digits that identifies the account.

formats.title: Response
formats.description: Returns the requested account object. Please see the account object schema section for more information.

sections.title: Update account
sections.content: You can update an account at the `PUT /accounts/:id` endpoint.

variants.content:
```bash
data=\
'{
    "userName": "anushka",
    "firstName": "Anushka",
    "lastName": "Madyanam",
    "emailAddress": "anushka@hubblesuite.com",
    "phoneNumber": "+91 XXXXXXXXXX",
    "addressLine1": "Flat #118, V8 Residency",
    "addressLine2": "16th Cross, NG Road",
    "city": "Bengaluru",
    "state": "Karnataka",
    "country": "India",
    "zipCode": "560005"
}'
echo $data | curl -X POST https://api.hubblesuite.com/accounts/5f6190b1966a8f0fd205a00a \
-H "Authorization: Bearer <API_KEY>" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d @-
```
